docs.snippet: THE CONGRESSMAN ELECT.--A paragraph in the Evening Post of yesterday, to the effect that Mr. HUMPHREY, Congressman elect from the Second District, was seriously ill, "in consequence of the excitement of the election," caused considerable apprehension...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE CONGRESSMAN ELECT.--A paragraph in the Evening Post of yesterday, to the effect that Mr. HUMPHREY, Congressman elect from the Second District, was seriously ill, "in consequence of the excitement of the election," caused considerable apprehension among the friends of that gentleman. His house was besieged with anxious inquires, We are glad to state that the report is wholly unfounded.

docs.snippet: The Boston Traveller, of yesterday, says: "Letters recently received from Mr. Sumner represent his health as being considerably improved. He writes that the physicians at Aix will probably attribute his improvement to the baths; Dr. Brown Sequard...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Boston Traveller, of yesterday, says: "Letters recently received from Mr. Sumner represent his health as being considerably improved. He writes that the physicians at Aix will probably attribute his improvement to the baths; Dr. Brown Sequard will think it is the result of the moxa, and his friends at home may suppose that relaxation from labor is the causes but of the fact that he is much improved in health there is no doubt.

docs.snippet: We have some additional items of news from California, Oregin and Utah by the Overland Mail. A dispatch from Oregon, dated the 22d of September, mentions a rumor that two of the most prominent hostile Indian chiefs have been captured and shot. A...
docs.lead_paragraph: We have some additional items of news from California, Oregin and Utah by the Overland Mail. A dispatch from Oregon, dated the 22d of September, mentions a rumor that two of the most prominent hostile Indian chiefs have been captured and shot. A messenger from Fort Vancouver hall arrived at Shasta, with dispatches destined for Fort Reading,

headline.main: EUROPE.; ADVICES FOUR DAYS LATER. Arrival of the Circassian at St. Johns. Settlement of the Difficulty Between France and Portugal. SOUNDINGS FOR A NEW ATLANTIC TETEGRAPH. Cotton at a Decline -- Breadstuffs and Provisions Heavy--Consols 98 1/4 @ 98

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw steamship Circassian, from Galway on the morning of the 27th ult., arrived at this port at 6 1/2 o'clock last evening. The first part of the voyage the Circasian encountered stormy weather. She has 300 passengers for New-York. By this arrival we have Liverpool and London mail advices of the evening of the 25th, and telegraphic accounts to noon of the 26th.

headline.main: TEXAS.; Character of the Country-Its Inducements to Settlers-Interesting Letter from G. W. Kendall, Esq. From the New-Orleans Picayune.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before attempting a description of this particular section of Texas, I wish to state distinctly that I have taken out no copyright for my article. On the confrary, I shall esteem it as an especial favor If all my old felow-members of the editorial craft will give me a place in their columns, as by so doing they will save me a world of trouble.

docs.snippet: One of the most shocking, and fortunately one of the rarest accidents to which we are subject in the Harbor of New-York, occured on Saturday last, resulting in the destruction of a steam-tug, and the instant death of three persons who were on board...
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most shocking, and fortunately one of the rarest accidents to which we are subject in the Harbor of New-York, occured on Saturday last, resulting in the destruction of a steam-tug, and the instant death of three persons who were on board at the time.
